comment.text: Troponin I is the inhibitory subunit of troponin, the thin filament regulatory complex which confers calcium-sensitivity to striated muscle actomyosin ATPase activity.
Binds to actin and tropomyosin. Interacts with TRIM63. Interacts with STK4/MST1.

Phosphorylated at Ser-42 and Ser-44 by PRKCE; phosphorylation increases myocardium contractile dysfunction (By similarity). Phosphorylated at Ser-23 and Ser-24 by PRKD1; phosphorylation reduces myofilament calcium sensitivity. Phosphorylated preferentially at Thr-31. Phosphorylation by STK4/MST1 alters its binding affinity to TNNC1 (cardiac Tn-C) and TNNT2 (cardiac Tn-T).

disease.name: Cardiomyopathy, familial hypertrophic 7
disease.description: A hereditary heart disorder characterized by ventricular hypertrophy, which is usually asymmetric and often involves the interventricular septum. The symptoms include dyspnea, syncope, collapse, palpitations, and chest pain. They can be readily provoked by exercise. The disorder has inter- and intrafamilial variability ranging from benign to malignant forms with high risk of cardiac failure and sudden cardiac death.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Cardiomyopathy, familial restrictive 1
disease.description: A heart disorder characterized by impaired filling of the ventricles with reduced diastolic volume, in the presence of normal or near normal wall thickness and systolic function.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Cardiomyopathy, dilated 2A
disease.description: A disorder characterized by ventricular dilation and impaired systolic function, resulting in congestive heart failure and arrhythmia. Patients are at risk of premature death.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Cardiomyopathy, dilated 1FF
disease.description: A disorder characterized by ventricular dilation and impaired systolic function, resulting in congestive heart failure and arrhythmia. Patients are at risk of premature death.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the troponin I family.

property.value: NON RARE IN EUROPE: Familial isolated hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
Expressed in apex of heart and 127 other tissues
P:regulation of cardiac muscle contraction by calcium ion signaling
P:regulation of systemic arterial blood pressure by ischemic conditions

feature.description: Involved in binding TNC and actin
Polymorphism; risk factor for CMH7; dbSNP:rs77615401.
